Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of Nathan Deal's changes to the HOPE scholarship program by stating that "literally 100,000 Georgians will not be able to go to college or get technical training."
Understate: The claim may understate the reasons behind Nathan Deal's changes to the HOPE scholarship program, as it does not provide a comprehensive explanation for why the changes were made.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that 100,000 Georgians will be unable to attend college or receive technical training as a result of the changes to the HOPE scholarship program.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the changes made by Nathan Deal to the HOPE scholarship program were solely responsible for the decrease in the number of students receiving the scholarship, without considering other factors that may have contributed to the decline.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the decrease in the number of students receiving the HOPE scholarship, such as changes in eligibility criteria or shifts in student demographics, which are not addressed in the claim.
